medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has experienced night blindness since childhood, diagnosed with fundus albipunctatus at age 8. Best-corrected visual acuity was 0.9 at age 8, reduced to 0.5 by age 18. Goldmann perimetry showed no significant abnormalities at ages 12 and 14. At age 18, Humphrey 30-2 perimetry demonstrated patchy reduction of sensitivity in central visual fields.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Fundus albipunctatus diagnosed at age 8; no significant retinal abnormalities noted in family members.
medical_history.family_history: Parents and one sibling carried single heterozygous mutations in RPE65 but were unaffected. No history of retinal disease in the family.
